--- title: "Probability Theory" --- ::: callout-note You can delete everything in here and start fresh. ::: This is a `.qmd` file. It is plain text with special features. Any time you write just like this, it will be compiled to normal text in the website. If you put a \# in front of your text, it will create a top level-header. To learn more about Quarto websites visit . # Assignment I ::: {.cell hash='01_probability_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-1_b429879bf3b59cff74f6c198679f6da8'} ```{.r .cell-code} # Given probabilities P_T <- 0.8 # Probability of being on time P_Tprime <- 0.2 # Probability of not being on time P_S <- 0.3 # Probability of a change in scope P_Sprime <- 0.7 # Probability of no change in scope # Calculating probabilities P_T_and_S <- P_T * P_S P_T_and_Sprime <- P_T * P_Sprime P_Tprime_and_S <- P_Tprime * P_S P_Tprime_and_Sprime <- P_Tprime * P_Sprime # Sum of probabilities sum_of_probabilities <- P_T_and_S + P_T_and_Sprime + P_Tprime_and_S + P_Tprime_and_Sprime # Displaying the results cat("P(T ∩ S):", P_T_and_S, "\n") ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` #> P(T ∩ S): 0.24 ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} cat("P(T ∩ S'): ", P_T_and_Sprime, "\n") ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` #> P(T ∩ S'): 0.56 ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} cat("P(T' ∩ S):", P_Tprime_and_S, "\n") ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` #> P(T' ∩ S): 0.06 ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} cat("P(T' ∩ S'): ", P_Tprime_and_Sprime, "\n") ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` #> P(T' ∩ S'): 0.14 ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} cat("Sum of probabilities:", sum_of_probabilities, "\n") ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` #> Sum of probabilities: 1 ``` ::: ::: # Assignment II ::: {.cell hash='01_probability_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-2_57a186d8443f597b8b345227ced1b206'} ```{.r .cell-code} # Given probabilities P_A <- 0.423 P_B <- 0.278 P_C <- 0.1 P_A_intersect_B <- 0.073 P_B_intersect_C <- 0.033 P_A_intersect_C <- 0.088 P_A_intersect_B_intersect_C <- 0.005 # Percentage of customers using all three devices P_all_three <- P_A_intersect_B_intersect_C * 100 P_all_three ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` #> [1] 0.5 ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} # Calculate the percentage of customers using at least two devices P_at_least_two <- (P_A + P_B + P_C - P_A_intersect_B - P_B_intersect_C - P_A_intersect_C + P_A_intersect_B_intersect_C) * 100 P_at_least_two ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` #> [1] 61.2 ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} # Calculate the percentage of customers using only one device P_only_one <- (P_A - P_A_intersect_B - P_A_intersect_C + P_A_intersect_B_intersect_C + P_B - P_A_intersect_B - P_B_intersect_C + P_A_intersect_B_intersect_C + P_C - P_A_intersect_C - P_B_intersect_C + P_A_intersect_B_intersect_C) * 100 P_only_one ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` #> [1] 42.8 ``` ::: ::: # Assignment III ::: {.cell hash='01_probability_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-3_650d2fa464724c4fae48a7a0365c68d4'} ```{.r .cell-code} # Given probabilities P_B_A <- 0.97 P_B_notA <- 0.01 P_A <- 0.04 not_P_A <- 1 - P_A # Calculate the probability B P_B <- P_B_A * P_A + P_B_notA* not_P_A P_B ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` #> [1] 0.0484 ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} # Calculate the probability A|B P_A_B <- P_B_A * P_A /P_B P_A_B ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` #> [1] 0.8016529 ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} # Calculate the probability not_A|B P_not_A_B <- P_B_notA * not_P_A / P_B P_not_A_B ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` #> [1] 0.1983471 ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} # The following sentence # These results show that in case the alarm is triggered, there is a possibility of about 19.83% that the product is flawless and a probability of 80.16% that the product is faulty. ``` ::: # Text Formatting *italics* and **bold** superscript^2^ / subscript~2~ ~~strikethrough~~ `verbatim code` > Blockquote # Headings ## Header 2 ### Header 3 #### Header 4 ##### Header 5 ###### Header 6 # Links & Images [Quarto](https://quarto.org) ![Caption](../../assets/img/elephant.png) [![Caption](../../assets/img/elephant.png)](https://quarto.org) [![Caption](../../assets/img/elephant.png)](https://quarto.org "An elephant") # Lists * unordered list + sub-item 1 + sub-item 2 - sub-sub-item 1 * item 2 Continued (indent 4 spaces) 1. ordered list 2. item 2 i) sub-item 1 A. sub-sub-item 1 (@) A list whose numbering continues after (@) an interruption # Tables | Right | Left | Default | Center | |------:|:-----|---------|:------:| | 12 | 12 | 12 | 12 | | 123 | 123 | 123 | 123 | | 1 | 1 | 1 | 1 | # Source Code Use ``` to delimit blocks of source code: ``` code ``` Add a language to syntax highlight code blocks: ::: {.cell hash='01_probability_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-4_7cd8d7e1eaae183cdeb474ee5a5a5407'} ```{.r .cell-code} 1 + 1 ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` #> [1] 2 ``` ::: ::: ::: {.cell hash='01_probability_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-5_2b65eb3156dc06cebbd054f5accb8640'} ```{.r .cell-code} cars ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} `````{=html}
````` ::: ::: ::: {.cell hash='01_probability_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-6_3aa36af2a5b9f3cbb24963ed8cc9ae65'} ```{.r .cell-code} plot(cars) ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](01_probability_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-6-1.png){width=672} ::: :::
